channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sustainability Reporting: Navigating Assurance Practices
item.description: Don't be lulled into a false sense of security by the word "assurance" when evaluating sustainability reports. Assurance practices vary, and investors would be wise to learn more about the different levels of coverage.

item.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy: An ‘embarrassing’ amount of your success in your 20s depends on your attitude
item.description: But aspirational workers need to follow through on a can do attitude with action, Jessy added.

item.title: The Power of Clicks, Likes, and Shares: Promote the Right Kind of Financial Content
item.description: Not all financial content creators on social media are created equal. A broad differentiation can be made between influencers, knowledge sharers, and aspiring thought leaders.

item.title: Chinese state media hints that Beijing might ‘hit back’ against European probes by targeting wine, dairy and aircraft
item.description: The EU is investigating Chinese subsidies across a range of industries, threatening tariffs for electric carmakers and keeping firms out of rail and energy tenders.

item.title: Why the New T+1 Settlement Cycle Matters: A Global Index Provider’s Perspective
item.description: Shorter settlement periods are meant to protect market participants. But the new T+1 settlement cycle for US equities may have undesirable knock-on effects for financial market participants around the world, including index fund managers.

item.title: Gen Z fueling limited-time flavors like Sour Patch Kids Oreos and pink lemonade-flavored Kit Kats
item.description: Food companies are responding to the changing and expanding tastes of consumers while also trying to keep brands relevant and distinct to win space on crowded store shelves.

item.title: Leveraging AI to Identify and Predict Financial Crises
item.description: Despite some current limitations, AI stands to offer significant advantages versus traditional approaches to identifying and predicting financial crises.

item.title: Utilities are doubling their 5-year electricity demand projections—but high interest rates and California's NEM 3.0 have U.S. solar in a holding pattern
item.description: Multiple macroeconomic and legislative challenges are slowing the growth of residential solar.

item.title: Why Your Portfolio Should Include Scarce Assets
item.description: Portfolios that include both productive and scarce assets can deliver similar performance to the S&P 500 with less risk than those that hold only productive assets.

item.title: Beijing is spending $42 billion to save its slumping real estate sector. Analysts say it’s nowhere near enough
item.description: The decline in China’s sales of new homes accelerated in recent months, with households increasingly preferring to buy in the secondary market.
